org.sadun.util.cache2
Class Cache

java.lang.Object
  org.sadun.util.cache2.Cache
public class Cache
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a key/value cache where the expiration criterium for the cached values is determined by an external controller.

Upon expiration of one or more entries, it produces expiration events which can be intercepted by registering an org.sadun.util.TimeBasedCache.ExpirationListener object.

Author:
Cristiano Sadun

Method Detail

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws OperationDeniedException
Places a key/value pair in the cache.

If the controller indicates that the pair be inserted, an OperationDeniedException is thrown.

This method triggers entry expirations as necessary.

Parameters:
key -
value -
Returns:
the replaced object, or null if no object was replaced
Throws:
OperationDeniedException

Parameters:

keySet

public java.util.Set keySet()
Returns the key set of the cache.

Note that the keys contained in the set may be associate to entries which will be expired upon later reading, so null may be returned when retrieving objects by key.

Returns:
the key set of the cache.

Add a listener to expiration events.

removeCacheListener

public void removeCacheListener(CacheListener listener)
Remove a listener to expiration events.

Parameters:
listener -

currentSize

public int currentSize()
Return the size of the cache at the moment of the call. Unlike size() no expiration is performed, so expired entries still present in the cache do count.

Note that such size may subsequently change if some entries expire.

Returns:
the size of the cache at the moment of the call.
